column4: can someone tell me if the 9.04 has the real cisco built in the kernel or does it use vpnc to connect
just wondering if it's a real cisco built in or not
it doenst come with any vpn client
but you can install vpnc from the repos or compile the cisco one from source
I know but you can install on 9.04 the vpnc-network manager module or such
i just use vpnc, it works flawless for me
I keep getting disconnected on idle
I also use vpnc right now

we have some old pix, i had problems with vpnc at first, it somehow killed the tunnel all the time, i think that was a result of some buggy dead peer detection code in vpnc, once i disabled that feature it worked well for me
damn yes my network admin at work uses pix he loves them
how do i disable that dead peer connection
you can start vpnc with --dpd-idle 0 to disable dead peer detection
there is also a config variable for that you can set in your config file
thanks man I'm gonna try it
since your so well educated let me ask do you also ever get issues with /etc/resolv.conf not returning back to default before vpn
it doesnt happen all the time just some times
i have it very often, that after i vpnc-disconnect it doenst revert back to the old resolv.conf
yes have you found a fix for that
but i was yet too lazy to look for a solution
hhaha
